intro: Ptarmica biserrata, commonly known as the serrated ptarmica, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to the temperate regions of Europe and western Asia, typically found in grasslands and open woodlands. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. It grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and is often used in traditional herbal medicine. Ptarmica biserrata is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appearance and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
